reviewText: In the wondrous outdoor setting of the Piazza della Republica in Cortona, a small town in Tuscany, Rieu  and his Johann Strauss Orchestra serenade us under the stars, and move many in the audience to tears with the beauty and sentiment of his performances. Rieu looks relaxed and as if he is thoroughly enjoying himself, and speaks in a halting Italian (with English subtitles), and makes fun of himself when he can't think of the right words. A charming personality and exuberant talent make him a one-of-a-kind musician, and a treat to watch and listen to.The orchestra is marvelous, and the female musicians and singers sparkle in their candy colored old fashioned dresses.Interspersed with some of the music are scenes of the lovely Tuscan countryside, as well as Venice.Among the songs played are:1: Nino Rota's Love Theme from "The Godfather". I adore this song, and have never heard it played so expressively.2: "Strangers in Paradise", which is the Borodin theme used in "Kismet".3: "Romance Anonyme".4: "La Paloma".5: Puccini's "O Mio Bambino Caro", sung by Carmen Monarca.6: Franz von Suppé's "The Light Cavalry".7: Johann Strauss' "Lagune Waltz".8: Johann Strauss' rousing polka "Thunder and Lightening".9: Ennio Morricone's theme from "Once Upon a Time in the West", with Carla Maffioletti.10: Offenbach's "Barcarole" sung by Carla and Carmen.11: "The Rose".12: "Ode to Joy" from Beethoven's 9th Symphony.13: Rossini's "William Tell Overture".14: a medley that includes Verdi's "La donna e' mobile" (from "Rigoletto"), "Libiamo" ("La Traviata"), "Triumphal March" ("Aida"), and Bizet's "Toreador Song" ("Carmen"), and much more, including an Italian pop number which has the audience enthusiastically singing along. Rieu ends with a song he wrote with his brother Jean-Philippe called "Ti Amo", the fitting finale for an enchanting night under Italian skies.Total running time is 120 minutes.

reviewText: I have 4 DVDs of Andre Rieu. This DVD is same as Live in TuscanyCortona. The Price was under US$20.00. I like most of the Program.

reviewText: I liked the performance of Andre Rieu and his orchestra. The selection of music was very good. As the performance was held in Italy, Andre's comments to the audience was in Italian but occasionally the subtitles were lacking for English speakers.

reviewText: Great Music, A must have for all classical music lovers, love to listen to it over and over again, purchased this for several of my friends and gave it to them as a gift. They all loved it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The strange title "Andre Rieu/Various" doesn't tell you much about what is store for you, but you will quickly be caught up in the happily exciting mood and almost feel that you are there, the way the cameras filmed the event.  I have never seen Andre Rieu live, but bought this DVD after a friend attended one of his recent concerts and couldn't stop talking about it. I know now why the concert affected him so deeply...I felt the same way after watching the DVD, and so did my husband.  The repertoire is great, the singers are excellent and there is a special joyous involvement between the players and the audience that leaves you wanting more. (I have since both another of his DVDs and am very pleased with it as well.)
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is probably Andre's best DVD to date..all the songs arefantastic..the 3 lady singers were fabulous..and he does a greatjob interacting with the audience (as always).
